data.title: Fix #17645.
data.body: Make endOffset correct when searching for matching pair. Details about the bug are put in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17645#issuecomment-273583417

data.title: yo code fails immediately
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. npm install -g yo
2. npm install -g generator-code
3. yo code

yo code
C:\Users\ray\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\yo\node_modules\configstore\index.js:69
                                throw err;
                                ^

Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, rename 'C:\Users\ray\.config\configstore\insight-yo.json.4205171772' -> 'C:\Users\ray\.config\configstore\insight-yo.json'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.renameSync (fs.js:809:18)
    at Function.writeFileSync [as sync] (C:\Users\ray\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\yo\node_modules\write-file-atomic\index.js:95:8)
    at Object.set (C:\Users\ray\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\yo\node_modules\configstore\index.js:62:21)
    at Object.Configstore.set (C:\Users\ray\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\yo\node_modules\configstore\index.js:93:11)
    at Insight.set (C:\Users\ray\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\yo\node_modules\insight\lib\index.js:50:15)
    at Object.<anonymous> (C:\Users\ray\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\yo\lib\cli.js:184:18)
    at Module._compile (module.js:570:32)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:579:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:487:32)

This smells like a npm issue, not Yeoman or Microsoft's generator, but figured I'd start here. :)

data.title: "meta.group.regexp" scope not highlighted anymore

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (39d761bf1f4ce7ea605539bdba41a8727b3c7ce0, 2017-01-18T07:10:04.990Z)
- OS Version: Windows 10

It seems like regex groups (`"meta.group.regexp"` scope) are not being highlighted differently anymore. This can be observerd in TypeScript regex literals. Here in the insider build:

![](http://i.imgur.com/cZiE4j1.png)

1.8.1 colors `(in)` slightly differently, which helps readability:

![](http://i.imgur.com/9EqeBhA.png)

data.title: Formatting on the fly to give Developer consistent formatting options across projects
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

VS Code should allow switching between formatting on the fly. Let me describe the scenario and the behavior. 
* Project has preferred Formatting settings. All commits should follow these settings.
* User has preferred Formatting settings. As a developer I always want to use these settings while editing

When a developer works across source bases some of the formatting differences are glaring and should not have to worry about the different formats. Git already has the very basic formatting on the fly ability with respect to CRLF.

VS Code can take this all the way to help developer not have to worry about formatting.

* When VSCode loads a file, it applies the formatting settings of the user to the file.
* When VSCode saves the file, it applies the formatting setting of the Project to the file.

As a first step, VSCode Workspace formatting options are applied on save and VSCode User formatting options are applied on load and while editing.

Any ideas?

data.title: Accepting a suggestion in the repl submits the whole input
data.body:
Not sure if it's valid but I find myself get it wrong quite often.

When we are typing in the editor and Code provides us a list of suggested keywords, I can press `tab` or `enter` to choose the highlighted keyword. My personal take is `enter`.

![editor-suggestion](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22077902/f5920150-dd6a-11e6-91fe-7a3e7fea6de8.gif)

While in the debug console, I pressed `enter` to pick the highlighted keyword on the list due to my muscle memory but it actually evaluated the keyword directly. Instead, I should use `tab` to choose the keyword.

![debug-suggestion](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22077955/2f1db7b6-dd6b-11e6-8dc5-3af27b7f00fa.gif)

Then I take a look at Chrome Dev Tools. If you press `enter` after typing the prefix of a keyword, it will just evaluate what you have just typed, not as smart as we do. If you use arrows to navigate in the list, and then press `enter`, it will pick the item instead of evaluating its value, which looks reasonable. 

![chrome-suggestion](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22078046/8cc517ce-dd6b-11e6-8e01-1e92822acdd0.gif)

File this issue to see if anyone other has the same feeling that the inconsistence really bothers.

cc @roblourens

I've tried both `fish` (which is the terminal I use daily) and `bash` without success.

Help?

data.title: Open new file buffer via API
data.body:
Second approach for some new API to fix https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12283

This time I settled on:

`openTextDocument(options?: { language: string; }):`

This is a bit of an ugly overload to be fair, so I am open to a different API shape. The reason it works nicely is because the first overload is a `URI` and the second is a `string`. The alternative would be to introduce a method like `openUntitledTextDocument`, which also a bit ugly, but more explicit at least.

data.title: Get listed on the JSON Schema website as a compatible editor
data.body:
I learned that VSCode supports auto completion of JSON files by using JSON schema.

> Source: http://schemastore.org/json/

However, you probably want to get listed on this page (that the above links to) for wider exposure.

> http://json-schema.org/implementations.html

You can edit the file here:

> https://github.com/json-schema-org/json-schema-org.github.io/blob/master/implementations.html

data.title: Quick Open show the "..." to the left or center to not hide important segments
data.body:
Addresses #18259

It was a little suprising that `QuickOpenEntryGroup` prints it's first entry child, so I had to add some logic in there as well, but I tried to keep the spread of the magic 44 number limited.

The `monaco-icon-label` being inline-block was impacting line-height, I tested with the seti icons and minimal icons and both still render correctly.

I don't see any regressions from removing some flexbox solution from @joaomoreno aa522145aa6b16ca88414142c932935dd933f830
* sidebar: twistie spacing 
* sidebar: full width rename
* sidebar: overflow ellipsis on resize

Sidebar icon alignments don't look consistent between seti and minimal, but are in a separate sheet, and seem to be inline with master. So no impact from this PR.

Initially I was worried about the semantics of using `direction:rtl` but i'm using it because we typically care about the end of the path more.

data.title: Add Tab Icons for open file tabs across the top

Add Tab Icons for open file tabs across the top of the IDE instead of just plain text.  This makes it easer to identify which files and file types you want to work on.  There are several other IDEs that allow for text only, text w small icons, and text with large icons as options for the tabs.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0

In my extension I need to access information from the launch.json file in code. I did not find any related services exposed in typescript definitions.

Is it possible to get parsed launch.json content in the extension code? 
If not, it it possible to invoke the built-in VSCode json parser to parse the contents myself?

data.title: Keep the history of find and replace strings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.9.0-insider
Commit 39d761bf1f4ce7ea605539bdba41a8727b3c7ce0
Date 2017-01-18T07:21:35.814Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:

Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any file, Enter find and replace strings
2. Close find & replace dialog & then close file
3. Open the same file. Click any word in the file & press `ctrl+f`. Your earlier search string is gone. You need to retype the whole search string & replace strings.

Like notepad++, you should have the ability to select previous search strings & replace strings. Otherwise, all complex regex you write for both search & replace strings are screwed as soon as you click in the wrong area and open the find dialog.

Currently `up` & `down` arrow move the cursor to the start & end of the search string, but they should be mapped to navigate search/replace string history

data.title: from [vscode-cpptools]: "Switch header/source" in split view opens file always in left view.
data.body:
Redirected from here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-cpptools/issues/444

Example: editor is split into two views. In the left view I have "file.h" opened, "file.cpp" is opened in right view. Issuing "C_Cpp.SwitchHeaderSource" command in "file.h" tab creates new tab "file.cpp" in left view. Seems like it should focus already opened "file.cpp" tab in right view. If there is no tab with corresponding source (or header) it should be created in the same view side by side with tab from which command has been issued.

![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24456989/21926730/165b3774-d994-11e6-80f0-1060f3ab447a.gif)

data.title: typingsInstaller/telemetry process causing high CPU usage
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Win 10 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode
2. Open process explorer, one of the child processes will be related to telemetry and eating CPU

I was experiencing high CPU usage and found the following process which was causing it:

`"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe" "c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\typescript\node_modules\typescript\lib/typingsInstaller.js" --globalTypingsCacheLocation C:/Users/x/AppData/Local/Microsoft/TypeScript --enableTelemetry`

![vscode-telemetry](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2523987/22063402/971bd6d4-dda4-11e6-8696-01d558fd3ef7.png)

(that's 20% with just one project, with a couple of projects it gets really worse)

Not sure if this is related to telemetry but I've already set `"telemetry.enableTelemetry": false` in user setting (as seen in gif) but still seeing the above process.
